name: bitbucket
label: Bitbucket
description: Bitbucket is a comprehensive platform designed to streamline the software development process. It encompasses all aspects of the development lifecycle, offering seamless integration and efficiency throughout the journey from initial project planning to deployment and beyond. With Bitbucket, teams can seamlessly manage their source code, facilitate collaboration, and ensure the quality and security of their software.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.tooltip: Specify the IP address or hostname of the Bitbucket server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.description: Specify the IP address or hostname of the Bitbucket server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.tooltip: Specify the username used to access the Bitbucket server to connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.description: Specify the username used to access the Bitbucket server to connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Access Token
fields.name: api_key
fields.tooltip: Specify the access token that is provided to you by a Bitbucket administrator that you will use to access the Bitbucket REST API.
fields.description: Specify the access token that is provided to you by a Bitbucket administrator that you will use to access the Bitbucket REST API. For information on generating access tokens, refer .

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.

operations.title: Create Repository
operations.description: Creates a new repository based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, within which to create the repository.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, within which to create the repository.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository to create on Bitbucket.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository to create on Bitbucket. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository to create.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository to create.

parameters.title: Repository Display Name
parameters.name: display_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository to create.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository to create.

parameters.title: Links
parameters.tooltip: Specify links in the JSON format. For more information about other fields, see connector documentation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify links in the JSON format
parameters.name: links

operations.title: Delete Repository
operations.description: Deletes a repository including all associated resources, like issues and pull requests, based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, within which to delete the repository.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, within which to delete the repository.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, whose repository is to be deleted.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, whose repository is to be deleted.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository to delete on Bitbucket.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository to delete on Bitbucket. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository to delete.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository to delete.

operations.title: Get File Details
operations.description: Retrieves information such as name, size, content, etc. about a file from the Bitbucket repository based on the repository ID, branch name, file name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, within whose repository the file is to be retrieved.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, within whose repository the file is to be retrieved.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, within whose repository the file is to be retrieved.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, within whose repository the file is to be retrieved.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository from which to retrieve the file.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository from which to retrieve the file. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository from which the file is to be retrieved.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository from which the file is to be retrieved.

parameters.title: Branch Name
parameters.name: at
parameters.description: Specify the name of the branch from which to retrieve the file.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the branch from which to retrieve the file.

parameters.title: File Name
parameters.name: file_path
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the file to retrieve.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the file to retrieve.

parameters.title: Size
parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Select to retrieve only file size. File content will not be retrieved. By default, it is set to false
parameters.tooltip: Select to retrieve only file size. File content will not be retrieved.

false.title: Type
false.name: type
false.description: Select to retrieve only type of file in the response. File content will not be retrieved. By default, it is set to false
false.tooltip: Select to retrieve only type of file in the response. File content will not be retrieved.

false.title: Blame
false.name: blame
false.description: Select to retrieve blame in the response. By default, it is set to false
false.tooltip: Select to retrieve blame in the response.

operations.title: Create or Update File Contents
operations.description: Creates or updates a single file in the Bitbucket repository based on the repository ID, branch name, file name and other input parameters.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, within whose repository the file is to be created/updated.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, within whose repository the file is to be created/updated..

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, within whose repository the file is to be updated.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, within whose repository the file is to be updated.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository in which to created/updated the file.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository in which to created/updated the file. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository in which the file is to be created/updated.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository in which the file is to be created/updated.

parameters.title: File Name
parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: Specify the name of the file to created/updatedcreated/updated.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the file to created/updatedcreated/updated.

parameters.title: Branch Name
parameters.name: branch
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the branch in which to created/updated the file.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the branch in which to created/updated the file.

parameters.title: Content Information
parameters.tooltip: Specify the contents to update in the file being created/updated.
parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Specify the contents to update in the file being created/updated.

parameters.title: Commit Message
parameters.tooltip: Specify the commit message for creating/updating the file.
parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Specify the commit message for creating/updating the file.

parameters.title: Source Branch
parameters.tooltip: Specify the starting point for branch. If provided and different from "Branch Name", branch will be created as a new branch, branching off from "Source Branch".
parameters.name: sourceBranch
parameters.description: Specify the starting point for branch. If provided and different from "Branch Name", branch will be created as a new branch, branching off from "Source Branch".

parameters.title: Source Commit ID
parameters.tooltip: Specify the commit message for updating the file.
parameters.name: sourceCommitId
parameters.description: Specify the commit ID of the file before it was edited, used to identify if content has changed. Note: Do not specify this field if to create new file.

operations.title: Update User Repository Permission
operations.description: Updates(promote or demote) a user's permission levels for specified repository.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization of the repository on Bitbucket whose user permissions is to be updated.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization of the repository on Bitbucket whose user permissions is to be updated.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the account holder of the repository on Bitbucket whose user permissions is to be updated.
User.description: Specify the account holder of the repository on Bitbucket whose user permissions is to be updated.

parameters.tooltip: Select the repository type, using which you want to update the user permissions.
parameters.description:
Select the repository type, using which you want to update the user permissions.
You can choose from Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository on Bitbucket whose user permissions is to be updated.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository on Bitbucket whose user permissions is to be updated.

parameters.title: Usernames
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify the comma separated usernames of the user's whose repository permissions are to be updated.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma separated usernames of the user's whose repository permissions are to be updated.

parameters.title: REPOSITORY Permissions
parameters.name: permission
parameters.tooltip: Select the access level to grant to the specified collaborator. You can select from following options:
parameters.description: Select the access level to grant to the specified collaborator. You can select from following options: No access , Minimal access ,Guest ,Reporter ,Developer , Maintainer. NOTE: Permissions are applicable only on organization-owned repositories.

operations.title: Get Member List of Repository
operations.description: Retrieves a list of group or repository members viewable by the authenticated user, including inherited members, invited users, and permissions through ancestor groups.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the collaborators.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the collaborators.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the collaborators.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the collaborators.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository to retrieve its collaborators.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository to retrieve its collaborators. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository from which to retrieve the collaborators.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository from which to retrieve the collaborators.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Specify a string to filter user names. Only user names containing this string will be returned.
parameters.tooltip: Specify a string to filter user names. Only user names containing this string will be returned.

parameters.title: Page
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to return the results of the operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to return the results of the operation.

parameters.title: Per Page
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

operations.title: Get Repository Branch List
operations.description: Lists repository branches for the specified repository on Bitbucket based on the repository type, organization or repository owner's name, repository name, and other input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, whose repository's branches are to be retrieved, in the Organization Name field.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, whose repository's branches are to be retrieved, in the Organization Name field.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: owner
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, whose repository's branches are to be retrieved, in the Repository Owner field.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, whose repository's branches are to be retrieved, in the Repository Owner field.

parameters.tooltip: Select the method using which you want to list of branches you want to retrieve from Bitbucket
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository whose, branches are to be retrieved from Bitbucket. You can choose from Organization or User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository whose branches are to be retrieved from Bitbucket
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository whose branches are to be retrieved from Bitbucket.

parameters.title: Filter Text
parameters.name: filterText
parameters.tooltip: Specify the text to filter retrieve branches contains the supplied string in name.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the text to filter retrieve branches contains the supplied string in name.

parameters.title: Boost Matches to Top
parameters.name: boostMatches
parameters.tooltip: Specify whether to exact and prefix matches boost to the top of the search results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify whether to exact and prefix matches boost to the top of the search results. By default set to false.

parameters.title: Retrieve Metadata
parameters.name: details
parameters.tooltip: Specify whether to retrieve plugin-provided metadata about each branch or not.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify whether to retrieve plugin-provided metadata about each branch or not. By default set to false.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: order
parameters.tooltip: Select the order to sort the results returned by this operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the order to sort the results returned by this operation. You can choose from the following options: ALPHABETICAL or MODIFICATION

parameters.title: Page
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which you want the operation to return the results of the operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which you want the operation to return the results of the operation.

parameters.title: Per Page
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

operations.title: Create Repository Branch
operations.description: Creates a new branch in the repository based on the repository type, branch name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to create the branch.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to create the branch.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository in which to create the branch.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository in which to create the branch. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name

parameters.title: Branch Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the branch to create.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the branch to create.

parameters.title: Reference Branch
parameters.name: startPoint
parameters.tooltip: Specify the branch name or the commit ID from which to create the new branch.
parameters.description: Specify the branch name or the commit ID from which to create the new branch.

operations.title: Delete Repository Branch
operations.description: Deletes a branch from the repository based on the repository type and branch name that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, in which to delete the branch.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, in which to delete the branch.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to delete the branch.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to delete the branch.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository in which to delete the branch.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository in which to delete the branch. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository in which to delete the branch.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository in which to delete the branch.

parameters.title: Branch
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the branch to delete.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the branch to delete.

parameters.title: End Point
parameters.name: endPoint
parameters.tooltip: Specify commit ID that the provided branch is expected to point to.
parameters.description: Specify commit ID that the provided branch is expected to point to.

parameters.tooltip: Check to do just a dry run, Don't actually delete the branch.

operations.title: Get Pull Request List
operations.description: Lists pull requests for the specified repository on Bitbucket based on the repository type, organization or repository owner's name, repository name, and other input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, whose repository's pull requests are to be retrieved, in the Organization Name field.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, whose repository's pull requests are to be retrieved, in the Organization Name field.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: owner
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, whose repository's pull requests are to be retrieved, in the Repository Owner field.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, whose repository's pull requests are to be retrieved, in the Repository Owner field.

parameters.tooltip: Select the method using which you want to list of pull requests you want to retrieve from Bitbucket
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository whose, pull requests are to be retrieved from Bitbucket. You can choose from Organization or User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository whose pull requests are to be retrieved from Bitbucket
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository whose pull requests are to be retrieved from Bitbucket.

parameters.title: Pull Number
parameters.name: pull_number
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the pull request which is to be retrieved.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ID of the pull request which is to be retrieved.

parameters.title: Filter Text
parameters.name: filterText
parameters.tooltip: Specify the text to filter retrieve pull requests contains the supplied string in title or description.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the text to filter retrieve pull requests contains the supplied string in title or description.

parameters.title: State
parameters.name: state
parameters.tooltip: Select the state of the pull requests whose details you want to retrieve from Bitbucket. The state parameter filters the results returned by this operation to only pull requests that match the selected state.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the state of the pull requests whose details you want to retrieve from Bitbucket. The state parameter filters the results returned by this operation to only pull requests that match the selected state. You can choose between All, Open, DECLINED or MERGED.

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.name: direction
parameters.tooltip: Select the direction relative to the specified repository.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the direction relative to the specified repository. You can choose from the following options: INCOMING or OUTGOING

INCOMING.title: Target Branch
INCOMING.name: at
INCOMING.tooltip: Specify the fully-qualified branch ID of the target branch to filter the results returned by this operation to only pull requests that match the specified target branch name
INCOMING.description: (Optional) Specify the fully-qualified branch ID of the target branch to filter the results returned by this operation to only pull requests that match the specified target branch name.

OUTGOING.title: Source Branch
OUTGOING.name: at
OUTGOING.tooltip: Specify the fully-qualified branch ID of the source branch to filter the results returned by this operation to only pull requests that match the specified source branch name
OUTGOING.description: (Optional) Specify the fully-qualified branch ID of the source branch to filter the results returned by this operation to only pull requests that match the specified source branch name.

parameters.title: With Attributes
parameters.name: withAttributes
parameters.tooltip: Specify whether to return additional pull request attributes.
parameters.description: whether to return additional pull request attributes.

parameters.title: With Properties
parameters.name: withProperties
parameters.tooltip: Specify whether to return additional pull request properties.
parameters.description: whether to return additional pull request properties.

parameters.title: Draft
parameters.name: draft
parameters.tooltip: Specify draft status of pull requests to be retrieved.
parameters.description: Specify draft status of pull requests to be retrieved.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.name: order
parameters.tooltip: Select the order to sort the results returned by this operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the order to sort the results returned by this operation. You can choose from the following options: NEWEST or OLDEST

parameters.title: Page
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which you want the operation to return the results of the operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which you want the operation to return the results of the operation.

parameters.title: Per Page
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

operations.title: Merge Pull Request
operations.description: Accept and merge changes in the pull request based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, in which to merge the pull request.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, in which to merge the pull request.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to merge the pull request.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to merge the pull request.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository in which to merge the pull request. You can select from the following options: Organization and User.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository in which to merge the pull request. You can select from the following options: Organization and User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository in which to merge the pull request.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository in which to merge the pull request.

parameters.title: Pull Request ID
parameters.name: pullRequestId
parameters.description: Specify The ID of the pull request to merge.
parameters.tooltip: Specify The ID of the pull request to merge.

parameters.title: Merge Commit Message
parameters.name: message
parameters.tooltip: Specify a message to attach to the merge commit.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a message to attach to the merge commit.

parameters.title: Strategy
parameters.name: strategyId
parameters.tooltip: Select the strategy used to merge pull request.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the strategy used to merge pull request. You can choose from  'Merge Commit', 'Fast-forward', 'Fast-forward only', 'Rebase and merge', 'Rebase and fast-forward', 'Squash' or'Squash, fast-forward only'

parameters.title: Version
parameters.name: version
parameters.tooltip: Specify the current version of the pull request. If the server's version isn't the same as the specified version the operation will fail.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the current version of the pull request. If the server's version isn't the same as the specified version the operation will fail.

parameters.title: Auto Subject
parameters.name: autoSubject
parameters.tooltip: Specify whether you want prepend auto-generated subject to the Merge Commit Message or not.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify whether you want prepend auto-generated subject to the Merge Commit Message or not.

parameters.title: Auto Merge
parameters.name: autoMerge
parameters.tooltip: Specify whether you want automatically merge this pull request when all check passes.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify whether you want automatically merge this pull request when all check passes.

operations.title: Create Pull Request
operations.description: Creates a pull request for the specified repository on Bitbucket based on the repository type, organization or repository owner's name, repository name, and other input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, of the repository in which to create a pull request, in the Organization Name field.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, of the repository in which to create a pull request, in the Organization Name field.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: owner
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, of the repository in which to create a pull request, in the Repository Owner field.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, of the repository in which to create a pull request, in the Repository Owner field.

parameters.tooltip: Select the method using which you want to create a pull request on Bitbucket
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository in which to create a pull request on Bitbucket. You can choose from Organization or User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository on which you want to create a pull request on Bitbucket
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository on which you want to create a pull request on Bitbucket.

parameters.title: Head Repository
parameters.name: fromRef
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace head with a user like this: username:branch
parameters.description: Specify the name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace head with a user like this: username:branch.

parameters.title: Base Branch
parameters.name: toRef
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the name of the branch to which you want to pull the changes. 
The branch to which you want to pull the changes should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository
parameters.description: Specify the name of the branch to which you want to pull the changes. The branch to which you want to pull the changes should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

parameters.title: Title
parameters.name: title
parameters.tooltip: Specify the title of the new pull request that you want to create on Bitbucket
parameters.description: Specify the title of the new pull request that you want to create on Bitbucket.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: Specify the contents of the new pull request that you want to create on Bitbucket
parameters.description: Specify the contents of the new pull request that you want to create on Bitbucket.

parameters.title: Reviewers
parameters.name: reviewers
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma separated list of usernames to add as a reviewer to the pull request.
parameters.description: Specify the comma separated list of usernames to add as a reviewer to the pull request

parameters.title: Draft
parameters.name: draft
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to create the pull request as a 'Draft'
parameters.description: Select this option to create the pull request as a 'Draft'.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify the additional parameters in key-value format. For more information see, connector documentation.

operations.title: Create Pull Request Comment
operations.description: Creates a new note/comment on a pull request based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, in which to create a pull request comment.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, in which to create a pull request comment.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to create a pull request comment.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to create a pull request comment.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository in which to create a pull request comment. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository in which to create a pull request comment. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository in which to create the pull request comment.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository in which to create the pull request comment.

parameters.title: Pull Request ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of a pull request to create the comment.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of a pull request to create the comment.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: text
parameters.tooltip: Specify text for the pull request comment.
parameters.description: Specify text for the pull request comment.

parameters.title: Severity
parameters.name: severity
parameters.tooltip: Select the severity of the comment. You can choose from NORMAL: To add a comment, BLOCKER: To create a task.
parameters.description: Select the severity of the comment. You can choose from NORMAL: To add a comment, BLOCKER: To create a task.

parameters.title: State
parameters.name: state
parameters.tooltip: Select the state of the comment.
parameters.description: Select the state of the comment. You can choose from OPEN or PENDING.

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify other fields in the JSON format
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify other fields in the JSON format
parameters.name: other_fields

operations.title: Get Tag List
operations.description: Retrieves a paginated list of tags, sorted by the date when they were released, based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the list of tag.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the list of tag.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the list of tags.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the list of tags.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository from which to retrieve the list of tags. You can select from the following options: Organization and User.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository from which to retrieve the list of tags. You can select from the following options: Organization and User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository from which to retrieve the list of tags.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository from which to retrieve the list of tags.

parameters.title: Filter Text
parameters.name: filterText
parameters.description: Specify the filter text to retrieve the matching tags.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter text to retrieve the matching tags.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.tooltip: Select the sorting criteria to sort the results.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the sorting criteria to sort the results. You can select from the following options: ALPHABETICAL and MODIFICATION.

parameters.title: Page
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to return the results of the operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to return the results of the operation.

parameters.title: Per Page
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

operations.title: Create Tag
operations.description: Creates a new Bitbucket tag based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified. Developer level access to the repository is required to create a tag.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, in which to create the tag.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, in which to create the tag.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to create the tag.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, in which to create the tag.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository in which to create the tag. You can select from the following options: Organization: and User.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository in which to create the tag. You can select from the following options: Organization: and User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository in which to create the tag.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository in which to create the tag.

parameters.title: Tag Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the tag from where the tag is created.
parameters.description: Specify the tag from where the tag is created.

parameters.title: Target Branch
parameters.name: startPoint
parameters.tooltip: Specify the branch(ref) name or a commit ID from where the tag is to be created.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the branch(ref) name or a commit ID from where the tag is to be created.

parameters.title: Tag Message
parameters.name: message
parameters.tooltip: Specify the message to use if creating a new tag.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the message to use if creating a new tag.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the type of tag which is to be created.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the type of tag which is to be created.

parameters.title: Overwrite
parameters.name: force
parameters.tooltip: Specify whether you want to overwrite tag if tag with same name already exists.
parameters.description: Specify whether you want to overwrite tag if tag with same name already exists. By default , it is set to false.

operations.title: Get Server URL
operations.description: Retrieves the server URL (Web URL) of the configured Bitbucket server.

operations.title: Get Pull Request Comments
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all comments for a pull request based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the pull request comments.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the pull request comments.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the pull request comments.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, from which to retrieve the pull request comments.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository from which to retrieve the pull request comments. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository from which to retrieve the pull request comments. You can select from the following options: Organization, User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository from whose pull request the comments are to be retrieved.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository from whose pull request the comments are to be retrieved.

parameters.title: Pull Request ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the ID of a pull request whose comments are to be retrieved.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of a pull request whose comments are to be retrieved.

parameters.title: From ID
parameters.name: fromId
parameters.tooltip: Select the sort order to sort the results. You can select from the following options: Ascending and Descending. Default sort order is Descending.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the sort order to sort the results. You can select from the following options: Ascending and Descending. Default sort order is Descending.

parameters.title: From Type
parameters.name: fromType
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the activity item specified by From ID.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the type of the activity item specified by From ID. You can select from the following options: COMMENT, ACTIVITY. Note: Required if From ID parameter is provided.

parameters.title: Page
parameters.name: start
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to return the results of the operation.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the page number from which to return the results of the operation.

parameters.title: Per Page
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

operations.title: Clone Repository
operations.description: Clones the specified repository in a Bitbucket project based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: repo_type

Organization.title: Organization Name
Organization.name: org
Organization.tooltip: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, to clone.
Organization.description: Specify the name of the organization on Bitbucket, to clone.

User.title: Repository Owner
User.name: org
User.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, to clone.
User.description: Specify the name of the repository owner on Bitbucket, to clone.

parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the repository to clone. You can select from the following options: Organization and User.
parameters.description: Select the type of the repository to clone. You can select from the following options: Organization and User.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo_name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the repository to clone.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the repository to clone.

parameters.title: Branch Name
parameters.name: branch_name
parameters.description: Specify the branch name of the repository to clone.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the branch name of the repository to clone.

parameters.title: Clone As ZIP
parameters.name: clone_zip

true.title: Archive Format
true.name: archive_format
true.tooltip: Select an archive format from the following options.
true.description: Select an archive format from the following options. You can choose from zip, tar.gz, tar, tar.bz2.

parameters.tooltip: Select this option to clone the specified repository as a zip file.
parameters.description: Select this option to clone the specified repository as a zip file.

operations.title: Update Remote Repository
operations.description: Applies changes made in a FortiSOAR file to the specified remote repository that is cloned from Bitbucket based on the file IRI and cloned repository path you have specified

parameters.title: FortiSOAR File IRI
parameters.name: file_iri
parameters.tooltip: Specify the FortiSOAR file IRI whose changes replace in the specified local repository.
parameters.description: Specify the FortiSOAR file IRI whose changes replace in the specified local repository.

parameters.title: Cloned Repository Path
parameters.name: clone_path
parameters.tooltip: Specify the path of the cloned repository to which to apply the changes of the specified FortiSOAR file.
parameters.description: Specify the path of the cloned repository to which to apply the changes of the specified FortiSOAR file.
